The route of contagion was speculated as bats from a wet market in the city of Wuhan.
5 Further, phylogenetic analysis compared with sequencings of the pangolins virus and infected bats showed an intermediary animal host. There was similarity of 91% in pangolin and 90.5 in infected bats. Homology of the genomic sequences of pangolin and 2019-nCoV were highly conserved in the protein S amino acid sequences, suggesting the pangolin as the possible intermediary host. The common trafficking of jungle animals in China, such as the pangolin, gave some credibility to this analysis.
